Southwest Detention Center Notary

Mobile Notary at Southwest Detention Center (Cois M. Byrd) in Murrieta

On‑site notarization for inmates at Riverside County’s southwest area detention facility in Murrieta, also known as the Cois M. Byrd Detention Center. We travel from Los Angeles so inmates can sign powers of attorney, court documents, real estate paperwork, and other legal forms without waiting until release.

Located in the French Valley area between Murrieta and Temecula, serving the broader southwest Riverside County region. Appointments coordinated around facility visiting rules and security procedures.

Call or Text (213) 933‑2507 Schedule Southwest Jail Notary
Facility information

About the Southwest Detention Center (Cois M. Byrd)

The Southwest Detention Center, also known as the Cois M. Byrd Detention Center, is located in the French Valley area between Murrieta and Temecula in southwest Riverside County. Operational since 1993, this facility is operated by the Riverside County Sheriff’s Department and houses male inmates only.

  • Address: 30755-B Auld Rd, Murrieta, CA 92563
  • Also known as: Cois M. Byrd Detention Center
  • Operated by: Riverside County Sheriff’s Department
  • Population: Male inmates only
  • Approximate distance from Los Angeles: About 1.5 hours via I‑15
  • Area served: Murrieta, Temecula, Lake Elsinore, Wildomar, and nearby communities

Why inmates at Southwest need notary services

  • Active court cases — Declarations, affidavits, and supporting documents for Riverside County courts.
  • Powers of attorney — Authorizing family, friends, or attorneys to manage finances and property.
  • Real estate and business matters — Deeds, loan documents, and contracts tied to closing dates.
  • Family and financial planning — Custody, support, and financial documents that require notarization.

Note: Southwest Detention Center and Cois M. Byrd Detention Center refer to the same facility and may be listed under either name in inmate locator systems.

Documents we notarize

Common Documents for Southwest Detention Center Inmates

Powers of attorney & authorizations

  • General power of attorney
  • Limited or special power of attorney
  • Durable power of attorney for finances
  • Healthcare power of attorney / advance directive
  • DMV power of attorney for vehicle transfers
  • Bank and financial institution authorizations

Court, real estate, and other documents

  • Declarations and affidavits for court
  • Family law, custody, and support‑related documents
  • Grant deeds, quitclaim deeds, and escrow documents
  • Lease agreements and rental authorizations
  • Vehicle title transfers and business documents
  • Insurance claims, benefit forms, and other notarized forms
How it works

Scheduling a Notary Appointment at Southwest Detention Center

1. Contact us with the inmate’s information

Call or text with the inmate’s full legal name, booking number (if known), and a description of the documents that need to be notarized. Let us know your deadline so we can prioritize scheduling.

2. We schedule with the facility

Riverside County facilities require visits to be scheduled at least one day in advance. For attorney or professional visits at Southwest, we contact the facility directly at (951) 696‑3050 to coordinate. Because of the distance from Los Angeles, we plan the trip carefully to ensure timely arrival.

3. Prepare your documents

Have all documents ready and complete before the appointment — we cannot draft legal documents, only notarize signatures. If the inmate needs to review documents first, coordinate with their attorney or use the facility’s mail system.

4. The notary appointment in Murrieta

We travel from Los Angeles to Southwest Detention Center in Murrieta (approximately 1.5 hours via I‑15), clear security screening, and meet with the inmate in the designated visiting area. The inmate confirms their identity, signs the documents in our presence, and we complete the notarization with the appropriate certificate.

5. Document delivery

After the appointment, we return the signed and notarized documents to you, your attorney, escrow company, or other designated recipient — by hand delivery, courier, or mail depending on your timeline.

Call or Text (213) 933‑2507 Schedule Appointment

Tip: The Southwest Detention Center is also known as the Cois M. Byrd Detention Center. When using the Riverside County inmate locator, try both names. This facility houses male inmates only.

Pricing

Southwest Detention Center Notary Fees

Jail notarizations at Southwest Detention Center require travel from Los Angeles to Murrieta, coordination with facility staff, security screening, and wait time. Pricing reflects the distance and complexity of working within the facility’s procedures.

  • Southwest appointments: Higher than local LA‑area jail visits due to long‑distance travel
  • Price includes travel to Murrieta, coordination, wait time, and notarization
  • Additional signatures at the same appointment may be added for a reduced fee
  • Rush or date‑specific appointments may have additional fees based on availability

What is included

  • Travel from Los Angeles to Southwest Detention Center and back
  • Scheduling with Riverside County staff and confirmation of inmate location
  • Security screening, check‑in, and onsite wait time
  • Notarization of documents (California notary fees per signature)
  • Return of documents to you or your designated recipient

Final pricing depends on the number of documents, any special circumstances, and timing. Call or text for a quote based on your specific situation.

Common Questions

Southwest Detention Center Notary FAQs (Cois M. Byrd)

Where is the Southwest Detention Center located?

Southwest Detention Center is located at 30755-B Auld Rd, Murrieta, CA 92563, in the French Valley area between Murrieta and Temecula. It is approximately 1.5 hours from Los Angeles via the I‑15 freeway.

Is Southwest Detention Center the same as the Cois M. Byrd Detention Center?

Yes. The Southwest Detention Center and Cois M. Byrd Detention Center are the same facility, and it may be listed under either name in Riverside County inmate locator systems.

How do I confirm someone is at Southwest / Cois M. Byrd?

You can search the Riverside County Sheriff’s inmate locator online or call (951) 696‑3050 with the inmate’s name and date of birth to confirm they are housed at Southwest Detention Center.

How are visits scheduled at Southwest Detention Center?

You can call (951) 696‑3470 between 9:00 AM and 5:00 PM daily to schedule visits, and visits must be scheduled at least one day in advance. For attorney or professional visits, the facility is contacted at (951) 696‑3050 to coordinate directly.

Does Southwest house male and female inmates?

No. Southwest Detention Center houses male inmates only. If you are looking for a female inmate in Riverside County, check the Robert Presley Detention Center or contact the Riverside County Sheriff for guidance.

How long should I plan for a Southwest Detention Center notary appointment?

Plan for 4 to 5 hours total including travel from Los Angeles (approximately 1.5 hours each way via I‑15), security screening, wait time, and the signing. The notarization itself is quick, but travel and facility procedures add time.

Other jails we serve

Need notary services at a different facility?

We provide mobile notary services at jails and detention centers throughout Riverside County, San Bernardino County, Los Angeles County, and Southern California.

Riverside County

  • Robert Presley Detention Center (Riverside)
  • Larry D. Smith Correctional Facility (Banning)
  • John J. Benoit Detention Center (Indio)

Other Counties

  • San Bernardino County jails (selected facilities)
  • LA County jails (Men’s Central, Twin Towers, etc.)

Not sure which jail? Call or text with the inmate’s name and we can help locate them and coordinate the appointment. For an overview of all jail notary services, visit our Jail Notary hub page.
